author: RICARDO ALONSO-ZALDIVAR and MARTIN CRUTSINGER Associated Press
title: Social Security, Medicare funds at risk even before virus
description: The financial conditions of the government’s two biggest benefits programs remain shaky, with Medicare projected to become insolvent in six years and Social Security on track to no longer be able to pay full benefits starting in 2035
content:
WASHINGTON -- 
The financial conditions of the governments two biggest benefits programs remain shaky, with Medicare projected to become insolvent in six years and Social Security on track to no longer be able to pay full benefits starting in 2035.
